definitions.definition: Flexible material in a roll with a sticky surface on one or both sides; adhesive tape.
definitions.example: Hand me some tape. I need to fix a tear in this paper.

definitions.definition: Thin and flat paper, plastic or similar flexible material, usually produced in the form of a roll.
definitions.example: After the party there was tape all over the place.

definitions.definition: Finishing tape, stretched across a track to mark the end of a race.
definitions.example: Jones broke the tape in 47.77 seconds, a new world record.

definitions.definition: Magnetic or optical recording media in a roll; videotape or audio tape.
definitions.example: Did you get that on tape?

definitions.definition: (by extension) Any video or audio recording, regardless of the method used to produce it.
An unthinking, patterned response triggered by a particular stimulus.
definitions.example: Old couples will sometimes play tapes at each other during a fight.

definitions.definition: (from ticker tape) The series of prices at which a financial instrument trades.
The wrapping of the primary puck-handling surface of a hockey stick
definitions.example: His pass was right on the tape.

definitions.definition: A strong flexible band rotating on pulleys for directing the sheets in a printing machine.

definitions.example: Be sure to tape your parcel securely before posting it.

definitions.definition: To record, particularly onto magnetic tape.
definitions.example: You shouldn’t have said that. The microphone was on and we were taping.
I've finally got this thing taped.
